content.question: If all other factors are held constant, which of the following results in an increase in the probability of a Type <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> error?

choices.label: The true parameter is farther from the value of the null hypothesis.
The probability of a Type <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> error cannot be increased, only decreased.

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Make an appropriate claim or draw an appropriate conclusion.
